snippet: The abrupt end of Egypt’s first Islamist government was the culmination of months of escalating tensions and ultimately futile American efforts to broker a solution to keep President Mohamed Morsi in office.
abstract: Abrupt end of Egypt's first Islamist government was culmination of months of escalating tensions and ultimately futile American efforts to broker solution that would keep Pres Mohamed Morsi in office; aides say that as long ago as fall 2012, just after setting his authority above the courts, Morsi had spoken fatalistically about the possibility of his ouster from the presidency.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: The abrupt end of Egypt’s first Islamist government was the culmination of months of escalating tensions and ultimately futile American efforts to broker a solution to keep President Mohamed Morsi in office.

headline.main: Morsi Spurned Deals, Seeing Military as Tamed
headline.print_headline: Morsi Spurned Deals, Seeing Military as Tamed
